encouragement_balance.too_soft: You're doing great! Everyone has areas to work on.
encouragement_balance.too_harsh: Your control issues are alienating your team and limiting your effectiveness.
encouragement_balance.balanced: Your drive for control comes from high standards—a genuine strength. The growth opportunity is trusting others with important work. This doesn't diminish your standards; it multiplies your impact.
encouragement_balance.principle: Name the strength, explain the mechanism, show growth as expansion not reduction

structure_recommendations: Start with pattern recognition—help them see themselves
Connect behaviors to underlying drives and fears
Provide actionable insights, not just descriptions

combination_interpretation.overview: DISC profile determination requires analyzing which dimensions plot above the midline (65% threshold = 16 points) and their relative intensities

midline_threshold.explanation: Scores of 16+ out of 24 indicate high expression of that dimension

profile_matching_algorithm.step_2: Identify primary (highest score) and secondary (second-highest score)
profile_matching_algorithm.step_3: Apply pattern rules based on count and combination

D_primary.D_I: Calculate gap. If D-I ≤ 3: Inspirational. If D-I > 3: Results-Oriented
D_primary.note: D_S combination doesn't exist as two-dimension pattern (becomes Achiever which includes both)

S_primary.note: S_C handled in three-dimension if D also present

C_primary.note: C_I is Appraiser (handled above), C_D is Creative (handled above)

three_above_midline.S_D_C: Investigator (I is only dimension below midline)
three_above_midline.C_I_S: Practitioner (D is only dimension below midline)
three_above_midline.note: Only these two three-dimension classical patterns exist

concrete_examples.analysis: D=22 and C=18 both above midline (≥16). I and S below. Primary D, Secondary C → Creative
concrete_examples.interpretation: Strong D/C tension: wants immediate results (D=22) yet demands perfection (C=18). This creates the signature Creative pattern—innovative yet systematic, decisive yet cautious on major decisions

concrete_examples.analysis: D=18 and I=17 both above midline. Gap = 1 point (very small) → Inspirational
concrete_examples.interpretation: Nearly equal D and I create the Inspirational pattern. This person influences through coalition-building and persuasion rather than pure dominance. The small gap (1 point) means they genuinely balance results-drive with social charm

concrete_examples.analysis: Only D=20 above midline. I=14 is close but below 16 → Developer (Pure D)
concrete_examples.interpretation: Pure D pattern. The I=14 provides slight social awareness but doesn't fundamentally alter the self-reliant, direct, results-driven Developer profile. This person acts independently with minimal need for social validation

concrete_examples.analysis: D=21 and I=16 both above midline. Gap = 5 points (D clearly dominant) → Results-Oriented
concrete_examples.interpretation: Results-Oriented pattern: D dominates but I secondary provides social leverage. They use force of character to drive results, more socially aware than Developer but still primarily results-focused

concrete_examples.analysis: S=20 and C=17 above midline. D and I both low → Perfectionist
concrete_examples.interpretation: Perfectionist (C/S): Combines analytical precision (C=17) with patient persistence (S=20). Systematic thinker who follows procedures, resists change, maintains high quality standards

concrete_examples.analysis: Three dimensions above midline: D=17, S=19, C=18. I=7 is only dimension below → Investigator
concrete_examples.interpretation: Investigator (S/D/C): Objective, analytical, task-focused. Combines S-patience with D-drive and C-precision. Most task-oriented S pattern, least interested in people-pleasing. Dogged determination on technical work

concrete_examples.analysis: Three dimensions above midline: C=19, I=18, S=17. D=9 is only dimension below → Practitioner
concrete_examples.interpretation: Practitioner (C/I/S): Rare pattern combining analytical precision (C=19) with social warmth (I=18) and patience (S=17). Skilled in both technical AND people problem-solving. Prefers supportive roles over leadership

concrete_examples.analysis: Only I=16 above midline (barely). Others cluster near 15 → Balanced profile approaching Promoter
concrete_examples.interpretation: Marginally Promoter but essentially balanced. All dimensions close to midline suggests versatile, adaptive person who can access all behavioral modes situationally. Analysis should emphasize versatility and context-dependence

concrete_examples.analysis: Only C=16 above midline (barely). All others 14-15 → Balanced profile approaching Objective Thinker
concrete_examples.interpretation: Marginally Objective Thinker but fundamentally balanced. Should be analyzed as adaptable individual with slight analytical bias. Emphasize situational flexibility and ability to access multiple behavioral modes

concrete_examples.analysis: I=20 and S=18 above midline. I is primary → Counselor
concrete_examples.interpretation: Counselor (I/S): High Influence with Steadiness secondary. Warm, empathetic, long-term relationship builder. More socially proactive than Agent (S/I mirror pattern). Exceptional at relating to people, may be overly tolerant and conflict-averse

all_near_midline.interpretation: Balanced, versatile profile. Person can access all behavioral modes depending on context
all_near_midline.analysis_approach: Emphasize adaptability, situational flexibility, and context-dependence. Discuss how they might express different dimensions in different situations (work vs home, crisis vs routine, etc.)
all_near_midline.example: You have a rare balanced profile—all dimensions accessible to you. This makes you highly adaptable. You likely shift behavioral style based on what the situation requires rather than having one dominant mode

two_dimensions_equal.rule: Treat as Inspirational—the near-equality IS the defining characteristic
two_dimensions_equal.note: Exact equality reinforces the Inspirational pattern even more than 1-2 point gap

one_point_above_threshold.interpretation: Marginally Developer but very close to balanced. D barely crosses threshold
one_point_above_threshold.analysis_approach: Acknowledge the D lean but emphasize balance. 'You have a slight preference for direct, results-oriented approaches, but you're fundamentally balanced—able to adapt your style as needed'
one_point_above_threshold.caution: Don't over-interpret weak signals. A 16 vs 15 difference is not psychologically meaningful

flat_profile.interpretation: Extremely balanced or potentially invalid assessment
flat_profile.analysis_approach: Consider whether assessment was answered authentically. If valid, describe as maximally flexible individual without strong preferences
flat_profile.note: Very rare—most people have at least one dimension above midline

opposite_dimensions_both_high.interpretation: Creates internal tension and situational variability
opposite_dimensions_both_high.D_S_example: Achiever pattern (S/D)—desires both stability and results. Unpredictable switching between caring (S) and direct (D) modes
opposite_dimensions_both_high.I_C_example: Appraiser pattern (I/C)—socially warm yet analytically precise. Switches between influencing (I) and compliance (C) behaviors depending on context
opposite_dimensions_both_high.analysis_emphasis: Highlight the internal tension, situational triggers for mode-switching, and the versatility this creates

extremely_high_single_dimension.interpretation: Extreme pure style—behaviors will be textbook for that dimension
extremely_high_single_dimension.analysis_approach: Describe as archetypal example of the pure pattern. Emphasize both the power and the limitations of operating from single dimension
extremely_high_single_dimension.example: Your D score of 24 represents the strongest possible Dominance orientation. You are a textbook Developer—every characteristic of this pattern will resonate strongly. The challenge is that without other dimensions to balance, your D-drive operates unchecked

D_I_combinations.gap_4_to_7: Results-Oriented—D leads but I provides social leverage

gap_interpretation_guide.general_principle: Gap size indicates whether secondary dimension significantly moderates primary, or whether primary dominates

examples.interpretation: Secondary moderates primary but doesn't fundamentally alter it
Secondary is weak—behaviors primarily reflect pure primary dimension

cultural_considerations.swedish_context: Swedish culture values consensus, modesty, and work-life balance—frame assertiveness as 'healthy directness' rather than dominance
cultural_considerations.avoid_stereotypes: Don't reinforce negative stereotypes about any dimension—D isn't 'aggressive,' C isn't 'cold'
cultural_considerations.growth_mindset: Emphasize that DISC describes preferences, not fixed traits—people can develop any dimension

i_dimension.swedish_note: 'Socialt kompetent' resonates better than 'utåtriktad' which can imply extroversion requirement

s_dimension.swedish_note: 'Stabil' is positive in Swedish—emphasize this as strength in uncertain times

c_dimension.swedish_note: 'Kvalitetsmedveten' (quality-conscious) is highly valued in Swedish professional culture
